ai.summary: Meall Mor Trail is a 13.2 km moderate hike in the UK, offering a varied mix of grass, woodland, and open moorland with steady elevation and scenic viewpoints.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines well-maintained forest tracks, exposed grassy moorland, and some rocky sections. Expect uneven ground, occasional mud, and a few short ascents. The surface is typically firm in dry conditions but can be slick after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast and start early to avoid getting caught out in fading light. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and dress in layers; the UK climate can change quickly. Bring a map and compass or offline GPS, plus a fully charged phone and power bank. Carry enough water and snacks, plus a small first aid kit and emergency whistle. Let someone know your plan and expected return time. Stay on marked paths, and be cautious on exposed sections, where winds can be strong and footing can be uneven.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate layers with a waterproof jacket and pants
Map and compass or reliable offline GPS
Fully charged phone and a small power bank
Hat, gloves, and sun protection (sunscreen, sunglasses)
Small first aid kit and emergency whistle
Headlamp or flashlight (for early/late starts or poor light)
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn; can be tackled year-round with appropriate clothing and navigation in mind.

seo.title: Meall Mor Trail – 13.2 km Moderate UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Plan your Meall Mor Trail hike. A 13.2 km moderate trek in the UK with varied terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and gear recommendations.
